Loss of Global Connectivity: Without the internet, people would no longer be able to communicate with each other instantly across the globe. This would have a significant impact on businesses, governments, and individuals who rely on the internet for communication and collaboration. Confidence Score: 0.8

Economic Downturn: The internet has revolutionized the way businesses operate, and its absence would result in a significant economic downturn. E-commerce, online marketplaces, and digital services would all be affected, leading to job losses and decreased economic growth. Confidence Score: 0.9

Decline of Remote Work: The rise of remote work has been made possible by the internet, and without it, many employees would be forced to return to traditional office settings. This would lead to increased traffic congestion, energy consumption, and decreased productivity. Confidence Score: 0.8

Loss of Access to Information: The internet has made it possible for people to access vast amounts of information from anywhere in the world. Without it, access to information would be severely limited, particularly for people in developing countries. Confidence Score: 0.7

Changes in Social Dynamics: The internet has changed the way people interact with each other, and its absence would lead to changes in social dynamics. People would have to rely more on face-to-face interactions, which could lead to a more personal and intimate form of communication. Confidence Score: 0.6
